body:
If a pod is not scheduled because it cannot find a fit, you run into really ugly event output like the following:

``` shell
Error scheduling: failed to find fit for pod: &{{ } {ruby-sample-build-4 quota-demo /api/v1beta3/namespaces/quota-demo/pods/ruby-sample-build-4 67aa0386-fe69-11e4-ae1a-080027893417 3005 2015-05-19 20:55:39 +0000 UTC <nil> map[build:ruby-sample-build-4 buildconfig:ruby-sample-build name:ruby-sample-build template:application-template-stibuild] map[openshift.io/build.name:ruby-sample-build-4]} {[{docker-socket {0xc20fe85450 <nil> <nil> <nil> <nil> <nil> <nil> <nil> <nil> <nil>}}] [{sti-build openshift/origin-sti-builder:latest [] [--loglevel=0] [] [{BUILD {"kind":"Build","apiVersion":"v1beta1","metadata":{"name":"ruby-sample-build-4","namespace":"quota-demo","selfLink":"/osapi/v1beta3/namespaces/quota-demo/builds/ruby-sample-build-4","uid":"67a5402e-fe69-11e4-ae1a-080027893417","resourceVersion":"3003","creationTimestamp":"2015-05-19T20:55:39Z","labels":{"buildconfig":"ruby-sample-build","name":"ruby-sample-build","template":"application-template-stibuild"}},"parameters":{"source":{"type":"Git","git":{"uri":"git://github.com/openshift/ruby-hello-world.git"}},"strategy":{"type":"STI","stiStrategy":{"builderImage":"openshift/ruby-20-centos7:latest","image":"openshift/ruby-20-centos7:latest"}},"output":{"to":{"kind":"ImageStream","name":"origin-ruby-sample"},"tag":"latest","dockerImageReference":"172.30.142.156:5000/quota-demo/origin-ruby-sample:latest","imageTag":"quota-demo/origin-ruby-sample:latest","registry":"172.30.142.156:5000"},"resources":{"limits":{"cpu":"150m","memory":"300Mi"}}},"status":"Pending","config":{"kind":"BuildConfig","namespace":"quota-demo","name":"ruby-sample-build"}} <nil>} {SOURCE_REPOSITORY git://github.com/openshift/ruby-hello-world.git <nil>} {BUILD_LOGLEVEL 0 <nil>}] {map[cpu:{0.150 DecimalSI} memory:{314572800.000 BinarySI}] map[cpu:{0.100 DecimalSI} memory:{5242880.000 BinarySI}]} [{docker-socket false /var/run/docker.sock}] <nil> <nil> <nil> /dev/termination-log IfNotPresent 0xc20feb28a0}] Never <nil> <nil> ClusterFirst map[] false} {Pending [] <nil> []}}Node openshiftdev.local: PodFitsResources 
```

This makes the output of `kubectl get events` horrific to work with.

A better event would just read:

```
Error scheduling: failed to find fit for pod, Node openshiftdev.local: PodFitsResources
```

The pod is known from the involved object already so no need to encode it all.

labels.description: Lowest priority. Possibly useful, but not yet enough support to actually get it done.
labels.name: priority/awaiting-more-evidence

title: Hard to read output on failed to schedule events
